intro: Jenkinsonia lacera, commonly known as the slender jenkinsonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture that helps retain moisture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Jenkinsonia lacera is considered a species of conservation concern.
